summary: This document is an email chain between FBI personnel and a U.S. Embassy security officer on August 13, 2019, discussing international investigative activity following Jeffrey Epstein's death. It notes official information requests from the French Police and the French Ministry of Justice (MOJ) regarding Epstein's property in France and the U.S. government's coordination of a response.

persons.name: Marlene Schiappa
persons.context: French government minister who called for an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's activities in France in a public statement cited in a news article.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the international investigation; a registered sex offender found dead in an apparent suicide while held on sex-trafficking charges, with declared residence/property in France.

persons.name: Josh
persons.context: Mentioned as having passed information to the recipient in the context of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: French Ministers Call for Investigation
events.description: Two French government ministers, including Marlene Schiappa, called for an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's activities in France following his death.

events.title: U.S. Receives Official French Requests
events.description: The U.S. received official requests for information from the French Ministry of Justice (MOJ) and the French Police regarding Jeffrey Epstein, prompting coordination among U.S. investigative units and the DOJ.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in an apparent suicide while being held on sex-trafficking charges.

keyFacts: On August 13, 2019, the U.S. received official requests for information from the French Ministry of Justice and French Police regarding Jeffrey Epstein's activities and property in France.
French Gender Equality Minister Marlene Schiappa publicly called for a French investigation into Epstein's ties to France, citing the need to shed light for the victims.
The U.S. government was coordinating a response through relevant investigative units and the Department of Justice.

The U.S. Embassy's Regional Security Officer noted that U.S. Marshals notifications document international travel of registered sex offenders, which included Epstein's declared residence/property in France.
